I have completed the warmup exploration. Here is a summary of the codebase:

## Project Overview

This is a **React TypeScript portfolio website** for Diego Fotesco, a Full Stack Developer based in Barcelona. The project uses:

- **Framework**: React 18.3 with TypeScript
- **Build Tool**: Vite 6.0
- **Styling**: Tailwind CSS 4.0 with animations
- **Routing**: React Router v7.1
- **Deployment**: GitHub Pages (gh-pages)
- **Testing**: Vitest with React Testing Library

## Source Structure

```
src/
├── components/         # UI components (About, Contact, Experience, Hero, etc.)
├── data/              # Static data files (experiences.ts, projects.ts)
├── hooks/             # Custom hooks (useDevMode, useIntersectionObserver, useTypewriter)
├── pages/             # Page components (Home, NotFound)
├── providers/         # Context providers (ThemeProvider)
├── routes/            # Routing configuration
├── utils/             # Utilities (analytics.ts, scrollUtils.ts)
├── App.tsx            # Main app component
├── main.tsx           # Entry point
└── index.css          # Global styles
```

## Key Features

- Dark/light theme toggle
- Typewriter effect animation
- Intersection observer for scroll animations
- Developer mode toggle
- Contact form integration
- SEO optimizations with robots.txt and sitemap.xml
- GitHub Pages deployment with custom 404 handling

### Critical Files for Implementation

- `/Users/dfotesco/Portfolio/portfolio/src/App.tsx` - Main application component with routing
- `/Users/dfotesco/Portfolio/portfolio/src/components/` - All UI components live here
- `/Users/dfotesco/Portfolio/portfolio/src/data/experiences.ts` - Experience/work history data
- `/Users/dfotesco/Portfolio/portfolio/src/providers/ThemeProvider.tsx` - Theme context management
- `/Users/dfotesco/Portfolio/portfolio/vite.config.ts` - Build configuration
